name: GetFinancialAccountOwners
description:
Retrieve owners of a specified financial account.

This tool is used to list all the owners of a given financial account. It is essential when you need to verify or display the ownership details of an account.

parameters.name: ownership_object_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ownership object from which to fetch the account owners.

value_schema.description: The ID of the ownership object to fetch owners from.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the financial account to retrieve its owners.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: An ID to fetch the previous page in pagination, defining your place in the list.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of field names in the response to be expanded, specified as an array of strings.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: object_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of account owners to return, ranging from 1 to 100, with a default of 10.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor indicating the starting point for pagination in a list. Use the object ID from the previous response to fetch the next page.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.
